title: Missing jsx-quotes rule
body: 52d3401f953afcf09ca64dbbb177c6284832aae6 disabled the `jsx-quotes` rule in `eslint-config-airbnb-base` (presumably because the config is intended to deal with non-React rules) but the rule didn't get re-enabled on the `eslint-config-airbnb` side.

title: Add arrow function returning object.
body: Hi guys, I did something wrong with rebasing #837, so I opened this new PR. Sorry for the mess ;/

title: Please document no-restricted-syntax
body:
After moving to `eslint-config-airbnb-base` from `eslint-config-airbnb` I am now getting warnings related to the `no-restricted-syntax` rule (specified [here](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/d06147d279549c08dacd2ef4835cbccf2b1f1159/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L118)), but no documentation backing this up exists in [README.md](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/763416260ab791d2efd2cf175100d8e506bb7eaa/README.md).

Can the documentation be updated explaining the reasoning behind the choices in this rule?

---

In my particular case this was triggered on a `for...in` loop, so I'm _guessing_ that having `ForInStatement` in the list of forbidden nodes would fall into the [Iterators and Generators](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/763416260ab791d2efd2cf175100d8e506bb7eaa/README.md#iterators--nope) section.

title: eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y breaking changes
body: Lint works wrong with [eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y latest release](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/releases/tag/1.0.0). They have several breaking changes on their rule names.

title: Upgrade eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y 0.6.2 -> 1.0.1
body:
This new version renames most of the rules, and adds a number of new
rules that we will need to evaluate. I simply added them for now with
TODO comments so we remember to come back to them and make decisions
about each one. I also alphabetized the list to make it easier to find
what you are looking for.

title: Clean install warns about the react and a11y plugin, but not the import plugin
body:
I know there's a PR in the works to create a new "base" package, but I just did a clean install in a project and was surprised it didn't warn about the import plugin. Do you know why?

```
├── eslint-config-airbnb@7.0.0 
├── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^0.6.2
├── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-react@^4.3.0
```

title: Add `eslint-config-airbnb-base`

labels.name: semver-minor: tighten rules to match guide

body:
Fixes #751.

This creates a new package, `eslint-config-airbnb-base`, which will be used by the main `eslint-config`, and will contain only the JS-related rules, and not the React/JSX ones.

Once this is ready to go in, I'll publish the base package, excise the temporary commit, and then update + merge the PR.

title: Arrow function IIFE parens
Update config package readme
body: I missed a couple of things here when I added some eslint-plugin-import rules. I threw in a capitalization correction for free.

title: [guide] Attempt to clarify filename conventions
body: Fixes #817.

title: Enable import/no-unresolved and import/export rules

labels.name: semver-minor: tighten rules to match guide

body:
These come from eslint-plugin-import. We've been using a couple of these rules for a
while at Airbnb so it seems like a good time to include them in this
configuration. We've found the no-unresolved rule in particular to be
very helpful when working across a large codebase.

  https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import

Since the no-unresolved rule works on commonjs, I decided to include it
in the node configuration as well.

title: Link to eslint.org instead of github where possible
body:
In most cases we link to documentation on the eslint.org site instead of
on GitHub. I found a couple of stragglers and decided to make things a
little more consistent.

title: react/jsx-no-bind: arrow functions and garbage collection
body: I saw that you are allowing arrow functions with jsx-no-bind again. Part of the reasoning was that bind is slow while creation of arrow functions is not. The explanation on the eslint page only talks about garbage collection ("This is bad for performance, as it will result in the garbage collector being invoked way more than is necessary." - https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/master/docs/rules/jsx-no-bind.md). At first glance these seem to be two different types of reasons (speed of function creation vs. performance hit due to garbage collection intervals), but maybe I'm missing something?

title: [guide] [breaking] Disallow leading underscores
body:
… there’s no such thing as “private properties”.

Per https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/490#issuecomment-209126331

title: Max line length of 100 characters: allow URLs?
body: It is common to have URLs in comments, but they do not fit in `"maximumLineLength": 100` rule

title: 'React' is defined but never used
body:
```
src/client/index.jsx
--------------------
error  'React' is defined but never used  no-unused-vars
```

My .eslintrc:

``` json
{
  "extends": "airbnb",
  "plugins": [
    "react"
  ]
}
```

Package versions:

``` json
"eslint": "^2.7.0",
"eslint-config-airbnb": "^6.2.0",
"eslint-plugin-react": "^4.2.3",
```

I've tried setting 'React' under globals, I've tried adding the `jsx-uses-react` rule, (which appears to be set already). Neither worked for me. Removing `"extends": "airbnb"` fixes this issue.

title: Filename and directory structure
body:
I have a question about the naming convention, the styleguide specifies that if the file exports a single class, the name of the file should be the name of the class. (see https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#naming--filename-matches-export)

So something like this:

``` js
import CheckBox from './CheckBox';
```

What about the directory structure? Is there any preference?
Because, these 2 structures are good based on the styleguide, but the import syntax will be different.

```
├── src
│   ├── CheckBox
│   │   ├── index.js
│   │   ├── CheckBox.js
```

``` js
import CheckBox from './CheckBox';
```

```
├── src
│   ├── checkbox
│   │   ├── index.js
│   │   ├── CheckBox.js
```

``` js
import CheckBox from './checkbox';
```

Does airbnb have a preference?
For internal component, I find it ok to have import with capital letters, but in an external library, it doesn't seem very common to have `import CheckBox from 'component-lib/CheckBox';`
